text: The Rev. Dr. Taylor had the honour of dining with Her Majesty .
Prince Leopold walked in the grounds , attended by Mr. Duckworth .
The Queen drove out yesterday afternoon , accompanied
At the commencement of the service a chorale was sung by the choir of Her Majesty's Private Chapel .

OSBORNE , AUG . 2 . The Quran an ! Pireas Beatrice drove out yesterday afternoon , attended by Viscountess Clifden ; and Her Majesty walked in the grounds this morning with Princesa Louise and Prince Arthur .
Despatches were received yesterday at the Colonini Office from the Governors of the Australian Colonies and the North American Provinces . Despatches were sent to

The King of the Belgians , his Royal Highness Duke Philip of Würtemberg , and her Imperial Highness the Archdachess Thérèse , visited the Prince and Princess of Wales , at Marlborough House , and remained to luncheon .

BALMORAL CASTLE , MAY 21 . The Queen arrived at Balmoral yesterday afternoon at a quarter after 3 o'clock , accompanied by Princess Louise and Princess Beatrice , and attended by the Duchess Dowager of Athole , the Hon . Harriet Phipps , Malle . Norele , Sir Thomas Biddulph , Lord Charles Fitzroy , Mr. Sahl , and Dr. Hoffmeister .

WINDSOR CASTLE , APRIL 9 . The Queen drove out yesterday afternoon , attended by the Countess of Caledon and the Hon . Eva Macdonald . Princess Louise , attended by Lady Churchill , weat out riding . Princess Beatrice and Princess Blanche of Orleans drove out .

A deputation of the National Committee for the Recep tion of the King of the Belgians , consisting of the Lord Mayor of London , Lieutenant - Colonel Durnford , Mr. Edward Gourley , Captain Mercier , and Dr. Mill , arrived at Osborne yesterday , and had the honour of submitting to Her Majesty's inspection the casket containing the national address to the King and Queen of the Belgians .
The Queen , accompanied by the Dowiger Deniss of Athole , walked and drove in the grounds yesterday after

The Prince of Wales presided yesterday at a meeting on behalf of the funds of St. George's Hospital , held at the Han over - square Rooms . The Princess of Wales accompanied the Prince . In attendance were the Countess of Morton and General Sir William Knollys .
The Rev. Dr. Norman Macleod arrived at the Castle and had the honour of dining with the Queen and the Royal family .
The Viscount and Viscountess Sydney and the Right Hon . R. Lowe arrived at the Castle .
The Prince and Princess of Wales drove out yesterday morning .
The Rev. Dr. Taylor officiated .
Her Majesty in the afternoon went out , attended by Lady Florence Seymour ,

Their Royal Highnesses the Prince and Princess of Wales , the Duchess of Sutherland , the Dowager Duchess of Athole , the Countess of Macclesfield , and Viscount Bridport dined with the Queen yesterday .
Princess Christian dined with the Queen in the evening . -Her Majesty , accompanied by Princess Beatrice , walked and drove in the grounds this morning . Prince Leopold also went out
Despatches were received yesterday at the Colonial - office from the Governors of the Cape of Good Hope and St ... Helena . Despatches were sent to the Goveruor - General of Canada .
Two rows of chairs ( one on each side of the centre ) were ap propriated to the sponsors and the Royal personages invited to be present .
Professor Lister , Surgeon Extraordinary to the Queen , arrived at the Castle .
The Queen went out in the morning , accompanied by Princess Beatrice , and in the afternoon drove out , attended by the Marchioness of Ely and the Hon . Emily Catheart .
Prince and Princess Philip of Würtemberg and the Prince of Leiningen visited the Queen , and remained to
WINDSOR CASTLE , MAY 12 . The Queen , accompanied by Princess Beatrice , arrived at the Castle at 7 o'clock this afternoon from Claremont .

The Prince and Princess of Wales , attended by the Mar chioness of Carmarthen , the Marquis of Hamilton , and Lieutenant - Colonol Keppel , were present last evening at a ball given by the Hon . Artillery Company at their Armoury House in Finsbury .
The Princess of Wales drove out yesterday , attended by the Hon . Mrs. Coke .
Prince Arthur honoured Lord Heary Lennox by sailing t with him yesterday in his yacht .

Mr. W. G. Casins presided at the organ . Her Majesty then retired from the Chapel to the Green Drawing - room , accompanied by the Royal and distinguished guests , where the rest of the company followed and where the Baptismal Register was completed . Refreshments were afterwards served in the Dining - room . Lieutenant - General F. H. Seymour has succeeded Lord Charles Fitzroy as Equerry in Waiting .
The Prince and Princess of Wales gave a Garden Party on Saturday afternoon , at Chiswick , to which the following were invited , but some were prevented by unavoidable causes from attending
WINDSOR CASTLE , JULY 1 . The Queen , attended by the Duchess of Roxburghe , walked and drove in the grounds yesterday afternoon . Her Majesty , with Princess Beatrice , went out this morn ing .
The Countess of Caledon has succeeded Lady Churchill as Lady in Waiting .
The Queen went out in the morning , attended by Lady Churchill .
In the afternoon the Princess of Wales drove out , accom panied by the Princess of Teck .
The Rev. G. Prothero preached the sermon .
The Rev. G. Prothero preached the sermou .
The Earl of Morley and the Hon . Algernon W. F. Gre ville have succeeded the Earl of Camperdown and Colonel Lynedoch Gardiner as Lord and Groom in Waiting .
The Lord Chancellor and the Right Hon . G. J. Goschen had the honour of dining with the Queen and the Royal Family .

The Earl of Bassborough ( Lord Steward ) and Lord Otho Fitzgerald ( Controller of the Household ) arrived at Os borne to - day , and presented Addresses to Her Majesty from both Houses of Parliament in reply to the Queen's Speech .
Sir Hamilton and Lady Seymour have arrived on a visit to Her Majesty .
The Prince of Leiningen visited the Queen to - day , and remained to luncheon .

The Prince of Wales , accompanied by the Prince of Teck and Count Gleichen , and attended by Colonel Kingscote , Lieutenant - Colonel Teesdale , and Lieutenant - Colonel Ellis , was present on Saturday morning at the guard mounting parade in St. James's Park , in honour of the Queen's birth . day .
Princo Christian , attended by Captain the Iion . Charles Eliot , presided yosterday evening at the dinner on behalf of the British Orphau Asylum , at the Caunou - street Station Hotel .
Lady Fanny Howard and Lady Augusta Stanley had the honour of dining with the Queen and the Royal Family in the evening .
Their Royal Highnesses Princess Victoria and Princess Maude of Wales arrived at Osborne yesterday .
OSBORNE , AUG . 6 . The Queen went out yesterday afternoon , accompanied by Princess Beatrice , and Her Majesty walked in the grounds this morning with Princess Louise .
The Right Hon . H. Bruce arrived at Osborne yesterday , and had an audience of Her Majesty .
The Queen and the two Princesses visited the Prince and Princess of Wales at Abergeldie in the afternoon .
The Prince of Wales , attended by Lieutenant - Colonel Teesdale and Mr. F. Knellys , arrived in town yesterday from Scotland .
The invitations to the Garden Party given by the Prince and Princess of Wales at Chiswick on Wednesday afternoon included the following :
Miss Agnes Keyser had the honour of dining with The King and Queen this evening .

ant - Colonel Charles KEMPTON , Royal Engineers , Lieutenant Colonel Charles RADCI FE . Tank Corps ( also received the Distinguished Service Order ) . Lieutenant - Colonel Oscar the Distinguished Service Order ) , and Major Guy TOYNBEE , Royal Army Service Corps .

The Bands of the 2nd Dragoons ( Royal Scots Greys ) , the Scots Guards , and the Royal Scots ( Lothian Regiment ) , and the Pipers of the Scots Guards and of the Royal Scots have played selections of music at Holyrood Palace during Their Majesties ' residence .
WINDSOR CASTLE , APRIL 23 . Field - Marshal the Duke of Connaught , at tended by Lieut . - Colonel Sir Malcolm Murray , has arrived at the Castle .
church and afterwards at the parish hall adjoining .
The Right Hon . Austen Chamberlain , M.P. , had an audience of His Majesty previous to the Council .
WINDSOR CASTLE , APRIL 24 . Lieutenant Frank Marriott , late 12th Batta . lion , 1st Division , Australian Imperial Force , had the honour of being received by The King this morning .
WINDSOR CASTLE , APRIL 3 . The Very Revd . the Dean of Windsor and the Hon . Mrs. Baillie had the honour of dining with The King and Queen this evening .

Her Majesty , accompanied by the Princess Victoria , attended this afternoon at St. Anne's Church , Soho , at which Bach's Passion Music ( St. John ) was sung . The Hon . Charlotte Knollys was in attend ance upon Her Majesty .
The String Band of the Scots Guards played a selection of music during Dinner , under the direction of Lieutenant F. W. Wood . Their Majesties gave a small Evening Party
Equerry to Queen Alexandra , represented Her Majesty at the funeral of the Lady Wantage , which took place at Ardington this afternoon .

COMPANIONS - Major - General Neill MALCOLM . Brigadier General Frederic MOBERLY , Colonel Arthur BIRTWISTLE , Royal Artillery ( also received the Distinguished Service Order ) , and Colonel Edward EVANS , Wiltshire Regiment .
The Princess Royal and Princess Maud visited their Majesties .

His Excellency Doctor Vojtech Mastny was received in audience by The King this morning , and presented his Letter of Credence as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary from the Republic of Czecho - Slovakia .
The Queen , attended by the Countess of Minto , visited the Babies Hostel , Glebo Place , Stoke Newington .

ST . JAMES'S PALACE , OCT . 29 . The Prince of Wales , attended by Capt . the Hon . Piers Legh , was present at Waterloo Railway Station this morning , and on behalf of The King took leave of Major - General Prince Arthur of Connaught upon his departure from England for South Africa .

The King and Queen , accompanied by the Duke of York , the Princess Mary , and the Prince Henry , and attended by Major the Hon . Richard Molyneux and Major Reginald Seymour , visited the All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club at Wimbledon this afternoon , to witness the Challenge Round of the Gentlemen's Singles Lawn Tennis Championships .
The King and Queen , the Prince of Wales , the Princess Mary , and the Ladies and Gentle men in attendance , were present at Divine Service in the Private Chapel this morning .
Captain the Hon . Piers Legh and Major Louis Grieg were in attendance .
A Royal Salute was given as The King's Pro cession passed between the old and new Guards in the Forecourt of the Palace .
The Princess Royal , the Prince and Princess Arthur of Connaught , and the Princess Maud visited Their Majesties and remained to luncheon .
The King and Queen , the Princess Mary , the Prince Henry , and the Ladies and Gentle men in Waiting attended Divine Service at Sandringham Church this morning .

BUCKINGHAM PALACE , JAN . 22 . To - day being the Anniversary of the death of Her late Majesty Queen Victoria , the Royal Mausoleum at Frogmore was open , by The King's Commands , between the hours of 12 and 3 o'clock , for the servants and their families to visit it , when permission to pass through was extended to some of the residents of Windsor and the neighbourhood .
The Band of the Scots Guards played a selec tion of Music in the Picture Gallery during the afternoon , under the direction of Lieutenant F. W. Wood .
BALMORAL CASTLE , SEPT . 1 . Vice - Admiral Henry Campbell has left the Castle and Mr. T. B. Hohler has arrived .
Their Majesties , accompanied by the Prince Albert , the Princess Mary , and the Prince Henry , gave an Afternoon Party at Buckingham Palace .

MARLBOROUGH HOUSE , APRIL 16 . Queen Alexandra received this morning Miss A. M. Peterkin , General Superintendent , Queen Victoria's Jubilee Institute for Nurses , and presented her with the Gold Badge of the Institute , for long and distinguished service .
At the Council His Majesty pricked the List of Sheriffs for England and Wales .

The Right Hon . Sir Laming Worthington Evans , Bt . , M.P. ( Minister of Pensions ) also had an audience of His Majesty , and Major - General G. D. Jeffreys ( upon his appointment as General Officer Commanding , London District ) had the honour of being received by The King .
BALMORAL CASTLE , SEPT 3 . The Right Hon . Sir Frederick Ponsonby has arrived at the Castle .

By command of The King the Viscount Sand hurst ( Lord Chamberlain ) was in attendance at Victoria Railway Station this morning , and on behalf of The King , took leave of The King of Sweden upon his departure from England .

Companions . - Captain Oliver LEGGETT , EN . , and Lieutenant Colonel John BORASTON , Royal Field Artillery ( also received the Insignia of an Officer of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire ( Military Division ) ) .

On Their Majesties ' arrival at Balmoral Castle The King and Queen were received by the Royal Highlanders , under the Command of Captain J. D. Ramsay ( His Majesty's Commissioner ) , the Master of the Household , and the tenants and servants of the Royal Estate .

The deputation , consisting of General The Right Hon . Sir John Maxwell ( Colonel of the Black Watch Royal Highlanders ) , the Officer Commanding , the . Adjutant , the Sergeant Major and the Pipe - Major of the 2nd Battalion , was presented to His Majesty by Colonel the Duke of Atholl .

Vice - Admiral Ernest Gaunt had the honour of being received by The King when His Majesty conferred upon him the honour of Knighthood and invested him with the Insignia of a Knight Commander of the Most Honourable Order of the Bath ( Military Division ) .
The Earl of Bradford has succeeded the Earl of Onslow as Lord in Waiting to The King .
The Rev. S. B. Baron , Curate at Sandringham , officiated , and the Rev. A. Rowland Grant ( Domestic Chaplain to the King ) preached the Sermon .

The King and Queen , the Duke of York , the Princess Mary , Field - Marshal the Duke of Con naught , and the Ladies and Gentlemen in attendance were present at Divine Service in Crathie Parish Church this morning .

The Provost read and presented an Address from the Provost and Fellows . and Mr. W. Le B. Egerton , Captain of the School , read and pre sented an Address from the Boys . His Royal Highness replied to both Addresses .

The Right Hon . Winston Spencer - Churchill , M.P. ( Secretary of State for War and Air ) and Mrs. Spencer - Churchill , and General the Lord Rawlinson ( General Officer Commanding , Aldershot Command ) and the Lady Rawlinson have also arrived .
Brigadier - General the
Captain MACDON Royal Garrison

The King and Queen , accompanied by the Princess Mary , and attended by the Right Hon . Edward Shortt , M.P. ( Secretary of State for the Home Department , Minister in Attend ance ) and the Ladies and Gentlemen in Waiting , disembarked from the Royal Yacht and landed at Ramsey , and proceeded by motor - car to Douglas , accompanied by the Lieutenant - Governor and Mrs. Fry , the Governor's Secretary , and the Chief Constable . On their Majesties ' arrival at Douglas the following had the honour of being presented to the King and Queen by the Lieutenant Governor - The Bishop of Sodor and Man , the Members of the Legislative Council , the Speaker of the House of Keys , and the Chair man of the Harbour Commissioners .
BUCKINGHAM PALACE , DEC . 16 . The Prince of Wales visited The King and Queen to - day and remained to Luncheon .

British Red Cross Soclety - Miss Alice BURFIELD , Miss Mabes PEPPER , Miss Nellle PICKERSGILL , and Miss Lalla POOLE . Civil and War Hospitals . - Miss Annie DAWSON and Miss Ruth THOMPSON . Voluntary Aid Detachment .-- Mrs . Nancy HICK and Miss Doro thes SUTHERLAND OF FORSE .

The Prince Albert , attended by Wing Commander Louis Greig , presented Colours to the 2nd Battalion , 20th London Regiment , and afterwards unveiled a Memorial , erected at Blackheath , to the men of the 1st and 2nd Battalions of the Regiment who were killed in action during the War .
Vice - Admiral Henry Campbell has arrived at the Castle .
Their Majesties , accompanied by the Duke of York , the Princess Mary , and the Prince George , visited Queen Alexandra at Marlborough House and remained to Luncheon .
The Hon . Charlotte Knollys , the Hon . Lucia White and Colonel Sir Henry Streatfeild were in attendance upon Her Majesty .
Prince Waldemar of Denmark , with Princess Margaret , left Marlborough House to - day .. upon the conclusion of their visit to Queen ; Alexandra .
